items.sentence: I wonder whether or not Tom could talk Mary into helping us tomorrow.
I wonder whether or not Tom has already told Mary she has to do that.
Tom borrowed thirty dollars from Mary to buy John a birthday present.
I wasn\'t surprised when Tom told me he didn\'t want to go to Boston.
I wasn\'t surprised when Tom told me that he didn\'t want to do that.
Why don\'t you get rid of your motorcycle? You never ride it anymore.
Why don\'t you go buy yourself something pretty to wear to the party?
I asked Mary is she wanted to go to a party with me and she said yes.
My curtains were closed, so I didn\'t see what was happening outside.
She made it clear that she couldn\'t make it in time for the meeting.
It seemed unlikely that Tom wouldn\'t come to Mary\'s birthday party.
It shouldn\'t surprise you to learn that I don\'t like you very much.
It\'s been a long time since I\'ve seen any dragonflies in this area.
Think of how much worse it could have been if Tom had not been there.
I wish I could figure out how to get more people to visit my website.
If we don\'t leave soon, we won\'t get there while it\'s still light.
The policeman aimed his gun at Tom and yelled, "Hold it right there!"
The temperature went down to minus ten degrees centigrade last night.
There was no doubt in my mind that Tom would make the right decision.
I\'d just like to have a quick conversation with Tom before we leave.
I\'m sure Tom will be able to persuade Mary to go to Boston with him.
I\'ve heard that people can eat cat food without any harmful effects.
Please return the book you borrowed when you\'ve finished reading it.
I doubt that Tom has the courage to stand up for what he believes in.
My leg\'s gone to sleep, so I don\'t think I can stand up right away.
This is the kind of work that requires a high level of concentration.
Tom and I had dinner together when you and Mary were visiting Boston.
Tom and Mary fell in love while they were on a scientific expedition.
If I\'d only known how Tom felt, I wouldn\'t have gone out with Mary.
Tom asked Mary who she thought was the best-looking guy in her class.
Tom bought an old house and said that he would fix it all by himself.
I can\'t believe you would do something like that without telling me.
I can\'t remember the meaning of the word that I looked up yesterday.
The board of directors is going to discuss the proposal next Tuesday.
Just because Tom said he had never met Mary doesn\'t mean it\'s true.
Aren\'t you able to tell the difference between butter and margarine?
Tom had a hunch that Mary would bring her new boyfriend to the party.
Tom is going to have to stay in the hospital for another three weeks.
Tom is staying with his relatives in Boston for the next three weeks.
I just wanted some advice from someone who\'s already been to Boston.
Tom wondered why Mary couldn\'t speak French any better than she did.
Tom can\'t make up his mind whether to get a job or to go to college.
I\'m probably not the only one who\'ll volunteer to help Tom do that.
It\'s the first time in my life I\'ve felt so connected with someone.
Tom should\'ve asked Mary to marry him while he still had the chance.
Tom doesn\'t want to admit that Mary was right and that he was wrong.
I had a feeling that Tom and Mary would decide not to buy that house.
Tom didn\'t have the courage to tell Mary that he had made a mistake.
Tom got Mary to scratch the part of his back that he couldn\'t reach.
Tom hopes Mary knows that she shouldn\'t do what John told her to do.
